title: Rules Don't Apply - Warren Beatty
text:
Average Rating: 5.9/10 Top Critics' Reviews 
Fresh: It may be hyperbolic to describe Warren Beatty's Howard Hughes movie, "Rules Don't Apply," as a screwball "Citizen Kane." But that's what it feels like. – Stephen Holden, New York Times, Nov 22, 2016 
Rotten: Warren Beatty plays Howard Hughes with seductive charm, sneaky intelligence and buggy eccentricity. Sadly, Beatty as writer and director has chosen to make Hughes a supporting role, teasing a much deeper portrait.. – Peter Travers, Rolling Stone, Nov 25, 2016 
Fresh: This is a picture Beatty has wanted to make for years, and if the movie isn't the achievement it should be, it's at least entertaining in fits and starts. – Stephanie Zacharek, TIME Magazine, Nov 25, 2016 
Rotten: There's a gulf between Hughes as we know him and Hughes as Beatty portrays him, and once you get past the sugarcoating, the rest of this film is more bitter than sweet. – Michael Nordine, Village Voice, Nov 22, 2016
